template.description: This is the master template for your folders.
This is the master template for your data center templates.
This is the master template for your references.
This is a general CI dependency reference.
This job imports configuration items from an XML file.

attribute.description: File path to XML file, e.g. "file:///tmp/myimportfile.xml"

template.description: This job exports configuration items to an XML file.

attribute.description: Export all CIs based on this template (enter alias). Will export this and descendants according to the templates/instances attributes.

template.description: This job discovers networking devices and configurations and puts the result into folders. You must edit the 'target' attribute to match your network to discover.

attribute.description: Target format as specified by Nmap. Ex: scanme.nmap.org, microsoft.com/24, 192.168.0.1; 10.0.0-255.1-254
This reference makes sure that the job shows up as a link in the GUI in the Data Center folder (under References section).
Use this template to create IP address CIs.
Use this template to create DNS entry CIs.
Use this template to create Network Interface CIs.
Use this template to create hostname CIs.
Use this template to create network intreface card CIs.
List discovered network interfaces in this folder
List discovered DNS entries in this folder.
List discovered network interface cards in this folder.
List discovered IP addresses in this folder.

template.description: The 'Advanced Data Center' folder is the start point for browsing items in the configuration database. You can automatically populate the database with initital items by using the 'Discover Network' script available at Start Menu(Windows) or bin/discover.sh (UNIX).

attribute.description: This folder lists software packages in the DSL.

template.description: The folder lists running server applications.
This folder lists available software packages in the DSL.
This folder lists hostnames registered in the DNS. The names points to the discovered IP addresses.

attribute.description: This folder lists the hostnames of discovered IP addresses.
This folder lists network interface cards.
This folder lists IP-to-Hostname entries in the DNS.

template.description: Use this template to create CIs of persons.
Configuration for an installation of Apache software, i.e. a running Application.
Physical port to connect network devices.

attribute.description: Physical ports to connect network cables.

template.description: IP address configured in operating system.
An Apache delivers web pages to web browsers.
DHCP supplies network clients with an IP settings.

attribute.description: Contains a hostname configured in the DNS.
The rack is placed at this location.

template.description: License for certain software installation, i.e. running Application.

attribute.description: Uses DHCP service for dynamic assignment of IP addresses.

template.description: The DHCP application assignes IP addresses to client systems.
This is a application running on a server, generally providing service to clients over a network.

attribute.description: The server application is runs on an operating system, hosted by a specific computer system.
Listen port of this application server.

template.description: Red Hat's suite of operating systems.
An operating system enables applications to run on a computer system.

attribute.description: Operating system runs on a computer system
The OS has network interfaces setup to communicate over networks.

template.description: A web server hosts web content and delivers it to clients.
High level services delivered by the data center.

attribute.description: The service depends on a set of running applications.

template.description: The master template for hardware devices.
The master template for most of the user defined templates.

attribute.description: The unit is mounted in a rack
URL to software package file in the DSL.

template.description: The master template for most of the user defined templates.
Application running on a specfic computer system.

attribute.description: Person responsible for maintaining the running application.
Software configuration of the running application.
Path to directory where software files of the running application is installed.
Software installation package of the application.

template.description: IP to Hostname mapping configured in DNS.

attribute.description: URL to configuration file in the DSL.

template.description: The master template for most of the user defined templates.
The folder lists network interface cards.
